Mahakumbh | 5 things to do at the Kumbh Mela in Prayagraj - The Hindu
summary:
5 Things to Do at the Kumbh Mela in Prayagraj

Published: January 16, 2025 02:03 pm IST

Source: The Hindu

The Maha Kumbh Mela is a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to take part in the largest religious gathering in the world. With over 40 crore expected attendees, it offers unique experiences amidst the crowds and winter chill.

  • The holy dip: Experience purification at Triveni Sangam with rituals and evening Ganga aarti.
  • Meet the sadhus: Witness the fascinating and diverse sadhus while being aware of their varying natures.
  • AI in the Kumbh: Use technology like the Kumbh Sah‘AI’yak for travel tips and assistance.
  • Explore Prayagraj: Visit historical sites like Akbar Fort and the 700-year-old Hanuman temple.
  • The ghats beckon: Journey to nearby Varanasi for a spiritual experience at its historic ghats.
“Benares is older than history, older than tradition, older even than legend and looks twice as old as of them put together.” - Mark Twain

The Kumbh Mela in Prayagraj is not just a festival but a blend of religious, cultural, and technological experiences.
newTitle: 5 Things to Do at the Kumbh Mela in Prayagraj

Justice Krishnan Vinod Chandran sworn in as Supreme Court judge - The Hindu
summary:
Justice Krishnan Vinod Chandran sworn in as Supreme Court judge

Date: January 16, 2025 Source: The Hindu

Justice K. Vinod Chandran was sworn in as a judge of the Supreme Court by Chief Justice Sanjiv Khanna, raising the judicial strength of the Supreme Court to 33.

  • Formerly Chief Justice of Patna High Court, appointed to Supreme Court.
  • Appointment fills the vacancy of a judge from the Kerala High Court on the Supreme Court Bench.
  • Justice Chandran has been a High Court judge since 2011 and Chief Justice of the Patna High Court since March 2023.
  • He was recommended by the Supreme Court Collegium on January 7, 2025.
  • His tenure is set to last until April 24, 2028.
  • The Supreme Court Collegium highlights the importance of maintaining full judicial strength due to the significant backlog of cases.
“The workload of judges has increased considerably. It has become necessary to ensure that the court has full working judge-strength at all times.”

Justice Chandran's appointment is significant for addressing the pending cases in the Supreme Court and ensuring representation from the High Court of Kerala.
newTitle: Justice Krishnan Vinod Chandran Sworn in as Supreme Court Judge

title: PM Modi congratulates ISRO scientists for successful docking experiment - The Hindu
summary:
PM Modi Congratulates ISRO Scientists for Successful Docking Experiment

Published on: January 16, 2025 | Source: PTI

Prime Minister Narendra Modi congratulated the scientists and engineers at ISRO on the successful docking of two satellites in space, recognizing it as a significant achievement for India's future space missions.

  • The docking of satellites SDX01 (Chaser) and SDX02 (Target) was successfully executed.
  • This event is part of India's Space Docking Experiment (SpaDeX).
  • The docking procedure was overseen from the Mission Operations Complex at ISRO.
  • The SpaDeX mission is aimed at demonstrating in-space docking technology.
"Congratulations to our scientists at @isro and the entire space fraternity for the successful demonstration of space docking of satellites. It is a significant stepping stone for India's ambitious space missions in the years to come." - PM Modi

This achievement is expected to pave the way for future ambitious projects, including the Bharatiya Antariksh Station.
newTitle: PM Modi Congratulates ISRO Scientists for Successful Docking Experiment

title: INS Surat, INS Nilgiri and INS Vaghsheer commissioned: Three cheers for Indian Navy - The Indian Express
summary:
INS Surat, INS Nilgiri and INS Vaghsheer commissioned: Three cheers for Indian Navy

Date: January 16, 2025 Source: Indian Express

Three frontline combatants were commissioned into the Indian Navy at the Naval Dockyard in Mumbai.

  • INS Nilgiri is the lead ship of the Project 17A stealth frigate class.
  • INS Surat is the fourth and final ship of the Project 15B stealth destroyer class.
  • INS Vaghsheer is the sixth and final submarine of the Scorpene-class project.
These vessels represent significant advancements in India's naval capabilities.

The commissioning of these ships marks a pivotal enhancement of the Indian Navy's combat readiness and technological prowess.
newTitle: INS Surat, INS Nilgiri and INS Vaghsheer commissioned: Three cheers for Indian Navy

title: Can CAG reports be made public before being tabled in Assembly? Delhi High Court to examine - Bar & Bench - Indian Legal News
summary:
Delhi High Court to Review Public Access to CAG Reports Before Assembly Discussion

Published on: 16 Jan 2025, 5:35 am

The Delhi High Court is set to consider whether the reports of the Comptroller and Auditor General of India (CAG) can be made public before they are sent to the Legislative Assembly for discussion.

  • The issue stems from a public interest litigation demanding the publication of audit reports on government portals.
  • The BJP has called for a special Assembly session to table the CAG reports before upcoming elections.
  • Justice Yashwant Varma and Justice Harish Vaidyanathan Shankar remarked on the right to public information.
  • The CAG argues that reports must remain undisclosed until tabled in the Legislative Assembly.
  • The case will be revisited on January 24, 2025.
“The voters have a right to the disclosure of information which is essential for choosing the candidate for whom a vote should be cast.”

This case raises significant questions about transparency and the electoral process in Delhi.
newTitle: Delhi High Court to Review Public Access to CAG Reports Before Assembly Discussion

"The legal proceedings regarding his case are ongoing, and his candidacy raises questions about justice and accountability."

title: Justice K Vinod Chandran Takes Oath As Supreme Court Judge - Live Law - Indian Legal News
summary:
Justice K Vinod Chandran Takes Oath As Supreme Court Judge

Publication Date: January 14, 2024 | Source: [Source Name]

Justice K Vinod Chandran was sworn in as a Judge of the Supreme Court today, with the oath administered by Chief Justice of India Sanjiv Khanna.

  • Justice Chandran was previously the Chief Justice of the Patna High Court.
  • The Central Government notified his appointment following a recommendation by the Supreme Court Collegium.
  • There is currently no representation from the Kerala High Court on the Supreme Court Bench, necessitating his appointment.
  • Justice Chandran will serve a term until April 25, 2028.
“Justice Vinod Chandran has acquired significant experience in diverse fields of law,” noted the Collegium.

This appointment addresses the lack of representation from Kerala in the Supreme Court and highlights Justice Chandran's extensive legal experience.
newTitle: Justice K Vinod Chandran Takes Oath As Supreme Court Judge

title: ISRO successfully docks SpaDeX satellites in space, creates history - Hindustan Times
summary:
ISRO successfully docks SpaDeX satellites in space, creates history

Date: January 16, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

The Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO) has successfully completed the docking process of the SpaDeX satellites, marking a significant achievement in space history.

  • The SpaDeX mission launched on December 30, 2024, from the Satish Dhawan Space Centre.
  • This makes India the fourth country to achieve successful space docking.
  • The docking was initiated using a manoeuvre from a distance of 15 meters to 3 meters.
  • The PSLV C60 rocket carried two small satellites, SDX01 (Chaser) and SDX02 (Target).
  • The SpaDeX mission is intended as a cost-effective demonstration of in-space docking technology.
"India docked its name in space history! Good Morning India ISRO’s SpaDeX mission accomplishes historic docking success. Proud to witness this moment!" - ISRO

This accomplishment is seen as a significant stepping stone for India’s future ambitious space missions, with Prime Minister Narendra Modi congratulating ISRO for their success.
newTitle: ISRO Achieves Historic Docking of SpaDeX Satellites

title: Order II Rule 2 CPC Bar Won't Apply When Reliefs In Second Suit Are Based On A Cause Of Action Different... - Live Law - Indian Legal News
summary:
Supreme Court Ruling on Order II Rule 2 CPC Allows Subsequent Suit on Different Cause of Action

Publication Date: January 15, 2025

Source: LiveLaw

The Supreme Court today ruled that filing a subsequent suit based on a different cause of action is not barred under Order II Rule 2 of the Code of Civil Procedure, 1908. This decision stems from a case involving a dispute over a sale agreement.

  • The Court emphasized the distinction between separate causes of action in different suits.
  • A subsequent suit for specific performance was allowed after an injunction suit based on a prior cause.
  • The decision cited previous High Court rulings supporting this interpretation.
“In our opinion, the reliefs in the subsequent suit are in fact founded on a cause of action which is distinct from that which is the foundation of the former suit.”

In conclusion, the Supreme Court affirmed that the subsequent suit's different cause of action legitimizes the relief sought, ultimately dismissing the appeal against this interpretation.
newTitle: Supreme Court Ruling on Order II Rule 2 CPC Allows Subsequent Suit on Different Cause of Action

title: Isro docks SpaDeX satellites in space, sets stage for Chandrayaan-4, Gaganyaan - India Today
summary:
ISRO Successfully Completes SpaDeX Satellite Docking, Advancing Future Space Missions

Published On: January 16, 2025

Source: India Today

The Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO) achieved a significant milestone by successfully docking the SpaDeX satellites in space, marking India's entry into an elite group of nations with advanced space rendezvous capabilities.

  • The docking occurred at 3 meters distance between SDX01 (Chaser) and SDX02 (Target) satellites.
  • The successful maneuver was celebrated as a major step forward for India's ambitions in space exploration.
  • The mission supports future projects including Chandrayaan-4 and Gaganyaan.
  • ISRO also highlighted the importance of autonomous docking for future missions.
SpaDeX Docking Update: Docking Success! Spacecraft docking successfully completed! A historic moment.

This achievement not only illustrates ISRO's engineering prowess but also paves the way for India's aspirations in deep space missions and potential lunar exploration by 2040.
newTitle: ISRO Successfully Completes SpaDeX Satellite Docking, Advancing Future Space Missions

Delhi AQI 'severe': GRAP-4 reimposed. Are schools closed? What advisory said - Hindustan Times
summary:
Delhi AQI 'severe': GRAP-4 reimposed. Are schools closed? What advisory said

Publication Date: Jan 16, 2025 09:55 AM IST | Source: Hindustan Times

The Delhi Directorate of Education (DoE) has ordered all government and private schools to conduct hybrid classes for students up to Class 9 and Class 11 due to a severe dip in air quality.

  • The air quality index (AQI) in Delhi rose sharply from 275 to 396.
  • All schools must adopt 'Hybrid Mode' for classes up to Class IX and XI.
  • Stage 4 of the Graded Response Action Plan (GRAP) has been invoked, banning all construction activities and non-essential polluting trucks.
  • Delhi's air quality index has now reached levels above 400, categorized as severe.
  • Previous measures had resulted in schools moving to fully online classes, but hybrid classes have become necessary.
“All Heads of Schools of Govt., Govt. Aided, Unaided Recognized Private Schools of DOE, NDMC, MCD and Delhi Cantonment Board are directed to conduct classes in schools for children up to Class IX & XI in a 'Hybrid Mode'.”

This action is part of the ongoing struggle against high pollution levels in the capital, demonstrating the impact of environmental issues on education.
newTitle: Delhi AQI 'severe': GRAP-4 reimposed. Are schools closed? What advisory said

UP School Holiday: Sambal, Bareilly, & others extend winter vacations due to coldwave - The Indian Express
summary:
UP School Holiday: Sambal, Bareilly, & others extend winter vacations due to coldwave

Date: January 15, 2025 Source: Indian Express

Amid the cold wave conditions in North India, various districts in Uttar Pradesh have extended the winter vacations for school students up to Class 8.

  • The Delhi Directorate of Education directed schools to conduct hybrid classes for students up to Class 9.
  • Schools in Meerut, Mathura, Kanpur, Agra, Varanasi, Prayagraj, Amethi, Barabanki, Gorakhpur, and Ballia were open for all classes starting January 15.
  • In Ghaziabad, winter vacations for classes 1 to 8 have been extended until January 18.
  • The Telangana Board announced a school holiday for all intermediate colleges celebrating Makar Sankranti from January 11 to January 16.
  • Jammu and Kashmir schools for Classes 6 to 12 are closed until February 28 due to winter.
“Students are advised to stay in touch with their respective schools for information regarding the holiday schedule.”

This decision impacts a significant number of students amid ongoing coldwave conditions.
newTitle: UP School Holiday: Sambal, Bareilly, & others extend winter vacations due to coldwave

title: Bengaluru to face 6-hour power supply disruption on January 16: Check timing and affected areas - India TV News
summary:
Bengaluru to Face 6-Hour Power Supply Disruption on January 16

Publication Date: January 16, 2025 | Source: India TV News

The Bangalore Electricity Supply Company (BESCOM) has announced a scheduled power outage in parts of Bengaluru on January 16 between 11:00 am and 5:00 pm due to essential maintenance work.

  • The maintenance is necessary to ensure an uninterrupted power supply and enhance the reliability of the electrical grid.
  • The affected areas include Nagenapalya, Old Baiyappanahalli, and many more.
  • BESCOM has urged residents to cooperate during this essential maintenance period.
“This maintenance is deemed necessary to ensure an uninterrupted power supply in the future.”

Individuals are advised to contact the BESCOM helpline for updates and make arrangements during the outage.

summary:

The fourth day of the Mahakumbh Mela 2025 saw devotees from various backgrounds taking a dip in the Sangam at 5 am, despite a harsh cold wave affecting northern India. More than 6 crore devotees have participated in the first four days, with expectations of reaching 50 crore by the end of the festival.

The Mahakumbh Mela continues to serve as a major religious and cultural hub, showcasing India’s rich traditions and beliefs.

title: Train to Kashmir soon as last leg of project gets safety clearance - The Indian Express
summary:
Train to Kashmir soon as last leg of project gets safety clearance

Date: January 15, 2025 Source: Indian Express

The rail link to Kashmir is now ready to commence operations, as the Commissioner of Railway Safety (CRS) greenlit the final leg of the ambitious project — the 17-km Katra-Reasi section.

  • The CRS conducted a detailed inspection and found no issues with the project's infrastructure.
  • Trains will run during the day only due to security reasons.
  • The approved maximum speed for trains on this route is 85 km/h.
  • The first train to operate will be an eight-coach Jammu-Kashmir Vande Bharat train, designed for cold temperatures.
  • This project includes significant engineering feats, like the world's highest arch bridge and India's first cable-stayed bridge.
“The toughest challenge in the project was to give foundation support to the world’s highest arch bridge (359 metres) on the Chenab River.”

In conclusion, the dream of a train to Kashmir is now within reach, enhancing connectivity to this region.
newTitle: Train to Kashmir soon as last leg of project gets safety clearance

title: Delhi weather today: Rain lashes NCR, IMD predicts more showers; 29 trains delayed due to dense fog - Hindustan Times
summary:
Delhi Weather Today: Rain Lashes NCR, IMD Predicts More Showers

Date: January 16, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

A spell of overnight rain has affected Delhi and its neighboring regions, with predictions of light rain continuing through the weekend. The India Meteorological Department has issued a yellow alert for these areas.

  • Rain and thunderstorms are expected in Delhi until Sunday.
  • 29 trains are delayed due to dense fog conditions.
  • The minimum temperature is recorded at 12.05 degrees Celsius, with a maximum of 21.41 degrees Celsius.
  • Delhi's air quality index (AQI) is in the 'severe' range, with readings above 400 in several areas.
  • The central government has re-imposed GRAP IV restrictions due to declining air quality.
“An AQI between zero and 50 is considered 'good', 51 and 100 - 'satisfactory', 101 and 200 - 'moderate', 201 and 300 - 'poor', 301 and 400 - 'very poor', and 401 and 500 is considered 'severe'.”

In conclusion, the ongoing weather conditions in Delhi, characterized by rainfall and severe air pollution, emphasize the need for immediate public health measures and transport advisories.
newTitle: Delhi Weather Update: Rainfall and Dense Fog Impact Transport

title: Jan 20: Indians Brace For Trump's Two Signatures.. - Greatandhra
summary:
Indians Brace For Trump's Two Signatures

Publication Date: January 20, 2021

Source: Great Andhra

As Donald Trump prepares to be sworn in as President, his expected policy changes may significantly impact Indian citizens and their immigration prospects in the U.S.

  • Trump is likely to sign changes affecting birthright citizenship.
  • American-born children of foreign parents may no longer receive U.S. citizenship automatically.
  • Changes to H-1B visa requirements are expected, raising the minimum salary from $60,000 to $120,000.
  • These potential changes are a concern for Indians living in the U.S. and those wanting to immigrate.
“Such a salary may be possible for an average employee in Californian regions like Bay Area, but not in other areas.”

Should these policies be enacted, they will have lasting implications for the Indian community’s aspirations in America.
newTitle: Indians Brace For Trump's Potential Policy Changes

title: AIBE 19 Result 2024 Soon At allindiabarexamination.com, Know Simple Steps To Check - News18
summary:
AIBE 19 Result 2024 Soon: How to Check

Last Updated: January 15, 2025, 21:53 IST

The Bar Council of India (BCI) will soon release the results for the All India Bar Examination (AIBE) 19. Candidates who took the AIBE 19 exam on December 22, 2024, are advised to regularly check the official website, allindiabarexamination.com, for updates.

Steps To Check AIBE 19 Result 2024

  1. Visit the official website at allindiabarexamination.com.
  2. Look for the ‘AIBE 19 Result’ link on the homepage and click on it.
  3. A new page will appear, asking for your login details.
  4. Enter login credentials like registration number and password.
  5. Click the ‘Submit’ button.
  6. Your AIBE 19 Result 2024 will appear on the screen.
  7. Click ‘Download’ to save the result in PDF format.
  8. Take a printout of the result for future use, such as during the enrolment process.

The AIBE, approved by BCI, is mandatory for law graduates from the 2009-2010 academic year onward and aims to raise the legal profession's standard. Upon passing, candidates receive a Certificate of Practice, allowing them to practice in any court in India.
newTitle: AIBE 19 Result 2024 Soon: How to Check
